entry.title: Compressing Probability Distributions
entry.summary: We show how to store good approximations of probability distributions in small space.

entry.title: An Alternative to Huffman's Algorithm for Constructing Variable-Length Codes
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Conditionally independent random variables
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the notion of conditional independence and prove several information inequalities for conditionally independent random variables.

entry.summary: This submission has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Collaborative Gain in Resource Sharing Communication Networks
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: On "Bit-Interleaved Coded Multiple Beamforming"
entry.summary: The interleaver design criteria described in [1] should take into account all error patterns of interest.

entry.title: On Source-Channel Separation in Networks
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Regret and Jeffreys Integrals in Exp. Families
entry.summary: The problem of whether minimax redundancy, minimax regret and Jeffreys integrals are finite or infinite are discussed.

entry.title: A method for Hedging in continuous time
entry.summary: We present a method for hedging in continuous time.

entry.title: A Short Course on Frame Theory
entry.summary: A Short Course on Frame Theory.

entry.title: Use of Hamiltonian Cycles in Cryptograph
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Linear Complexity of Ding-Helleseth Generalized Cyclotomic Binary Sequences of Any Order
entry.summary: This paper gives the linear complexity of binary Ding-Helleseth generalized cyclotomic sequences of any order.

entry.title: Designing Incoherent Dictionaries for Compressed Sensing: Algorithm Comparison
entry.summary: A new method presented for design of incoherent dictionaries.

entry.title: Reply to 'Comments on Integer SEC-DED codes for low power communications'
entry.summary: This paper is a reply to the comments on 'Integer SEC-DED codes for low power communications'.

entry.title: Some refined results on convergence of curvelet transform
entry.summary: Article presents proof that M-term non-linear approximation of functions that are C^3 apart from C^3 edges in curvelet frame have squared L^2 approximation bounded by M^(-2).

entry.title: Tree structured sparse coding on cubes
entry.summary: A brief description of tree structured sparse coding on the binary cube.

entry.title: Systems of MDS codes from units and idempotents
entry.summary: Algebraic systems are constructed from which series of maximum distance separable (mds) codes are derived. The methods use unit and idempotent schemes.

entry.title: "Infographics" team: Selecting Control Parameters via Maximal Fisher Information
entry.summary: Team description paper for RoboCup 2014 Soccer Simulation League 2D.

entry.title: On Codes based on BCK-algebras
entry.summary: In this paper, we present some new connections between BCK- algebras and binary block codes.

entry.title: Power Law and Entropy
entry.summary: Shannon(1951) and Yavuz(1974) estimated the entropy of real documents. This note drives an upper bound of entropy from the parameter of the power law.

entry.title: Higher weight distribution of linearized Reed-Solomon codes
entry.summary: Linearized Reed-Solomon codes are defined. Higher weight distribution of those codes are determined.

entry.title: Gold type codes of higher relative dimension
entry.summary: Some new Gold type codes of higher relative dimension are introduced. Their weight distribution is determined.

entry.title: Comments on "Overdemodulation for High-Performance Receivers with Low-Resolution ADC"
entry.summary: This submission has been withdrawn by arXiv administrators due to misrepresentation of authorship.

entry.title: Parameters of two classes of LCD BCH codes
entry.summary: Historically, LCD cyclic codes were referred to as reversible cyclic codes, which had application in data storage. Due to a newly discovered application in cryptography, there has been renewed interest on LCD codes. In this paper, we explore two special families of LCD cyclic codes, which are both BCH codes. The dimensions and the minimum distances of these LCD BCH codes are investigated. As a byproduct, the parameters of some primitive BCH codes are also obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is a merged version of arXiv:1608.02169v1 [cs.IT] and arXiv:1608.02670v1 [cs.IT]

entry.title: On the variational distance of independently repeated experiments
entry.summary: Let P and Q be two probability distributions which differ only for values with non-zero probability. We show that the variational distance between the n-fold product distributions P^n and Q^n cannot grow faster than the square root of n.

entry.title: The entropy rate of the binary symmetric channel in the rare transitions regime
entry.summary: This note has been withdrawn by the author as the more complete result was recently proved by A.Quas and Y.Peres

entry.title: Two Proofs of the Fisher Information Inequality via Data Processing Arguments
entry.summary: Two new proofs of the Fisher information inequality (FII) using data processing inequalities for mutual information and conditional variance are presented.

entry.title: A Coding Theorem Characterizing Renyi's Entropy through Variable-to-Fixed Length Codes
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Proof of a Conjecture of Helleseth Regarding Pairs of Binary m-Sequences
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s), due a crucial sign error in Thm. 11.

entry.title: Optimal power allocation for downlink cooperative cellular networks
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Entangled Graphs
entry.summary: In this paper we prove a separability criterion for mixed states in $\mathbb C^p\otimes\mathbb C^q$. We also show that the density matrix of a graph with only one entangled edge is entangled.
entry.arxiv:comment: Part of M.Sc. Thesis of the first author

entry.title: Quantum communication is possible with pure state
entry.summary: It is believed that quantum communication is not possible with a pure ensemble of states because quantum entropy of pure state is zero. This is indeed possible due to geometric consequence of entanglement.

entry.title: Nonsymmetric entropy I: basic concepts and results
entry.summary: A new concept named nonsymmetric entropy which generalizes the concepts of Boltzman's entropy and shannon's entropy, was introduced. Maximal nonsymmetric entropy principle was proven. Some important distribution laws were derived naturally from maximal nonsymmetric entropy principle.

entry.title: On the Convexity of log det (I + K X^{-1})
entry.summary: A simple proof is given for the convexity of log det (I+K X^{-1}) in the positive definite matrix variable X with a given positive semidefinite K.

entry.title: Power Control in Distributed Cooperative OFDMA Cellular Networks
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Variations on the Fibonacci Universal Code
entry.summary: This note presents variations on the Fibonacci universal code, that may also be called the Gopala-Hemachandra code, that can have applications in source coding as well as in cryptography.

entry.title: Supplement to: Code Spectrum and Reliability Function: Binary Symmetric Channel
entry.summary: A much simpler proof of Theorem 1 from M.Burnashev "Code spectrum and reliability function: Binary symmetric channel" is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Problems of Information Transmission, 2007, v. 43, no. 1

entry.title: Lower bounds on the minimum average distance of binary codes
entry.summary: New lower bounds on the minimum average Hamming distance of binary codes are derived. The bounds are obtained using linear programming approach.

entry.title: On the Degrees of Freedom in Cognitive Radio Channels
entry.summary: After receiving useful peer comments, we would like to withdraw this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: After receiving useful peer comments, we would like to withdraw this paper

entry.title: Multiple-Description Lattice Vector Quantization
entry.summary: In this thesis, we construct and analyze multiple-description codes based on lattice vector quantization.
entry.arxiv:comment: Ph.D. Thesis, 250 pages. (Thesis advisors: R. Heusdens and J. Jensen. Promotor: R. Lagendijk)
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ph.D. Thesis, Delft University of Technology, ISBN 978-90-9021979-0, pp. 250, Gildeprint, June 2007

entry.title: Z4-Linear Perfect Codes
entry.summary: For every $n = 2^k > 8$ there exist exactly $[(k+1)/2]$ mutually nonequivalent $Z_4$-linear extended perfect codes with distance 4. All these codes have different ranks.

author.name: Denis Krotov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Sobolev Institute of Mathematics, Novosibirsk, Russia

entry.arxiv:journal_ref: transl. from: Diskretn. Anal. Issled. Oper. Ser.1., 7(4) 2000, 78-90 [Russian]

entry.title: A New Lower Bound for A(17,6,6)
entry.summary: We construct a record-breaking binary code of length 17, minimal distance 6, constant weight 6, and containing 113 codewords.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ars Combinatoria, Vol. 83, pp. 361-363, 2007

entry.title: Blind decoding of Linear Gaussian channels with ISI, capacity, error exponent, universality
entry.summary: A new straightforward universal blind detection algorithm for linear Gaussian channel with ISI is given. A new error exponent is derived, which is better than Gallager's random coding error exponent.

entry.title: Random Vandermonde Matrices-Part II: Applications
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, since it has been merged with Part I (ID 0802.3570)

entry.title: Use of self-correlation metrics for evaluation of information properties of binary strings
entry.summary: It is demonstrated that appropriately chosen computable metrics based on self-correlation properties provide a degree of determinism sufficient to segregate binary strings by level of information content.

entry.title: Linear code-based vector quantization for independent random variables
entry.summary: In this paper we analyze the rate-distortion function R(D) achievable using linear codes over GF(q), where q is a prime number.

entry.title: Regularization of Invers Problem for M-Ary Channel
entry.summary: The problem of computation of parameters of m-ary channel is considered. It is demonstrated that although the problem is ill-posed, it is possible turning of the parameters of the system and transform the problem to well-posed one.

entry.title: Construction of Error-Correcting Codes for Random Network Coding
entry.summary: In this work we present error-correcting codes for random network coding based on rank- metric codes, Ferrers diagrams, and puncturing. For most parameters, the constructed codes are larger than all previously known codes.

entry.title: An outer bound for 2-receiver discrete memoryless broadcast channels
entry.summary: An outer bound to the two-receiver discrete memoryless broadcast channel is presented. We compare it to the known outer bounds and show that the outer bound presented is at least as tight as the existing bounds.

entry.title: Mutual information is copula entropy
entry.summary: We prove that mutual information is actually negative copula entropy, based on which a method for mutual information estimation is proposed.

entry.title: Cognitive MIMO Radio: A Competitive Optimality Design Based on Subspace Projections
entry.summary: Cognitive MIMO Radio: A Competitive Optimality Design Based on Subspace Projections
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Signal Processing Magazine Special Issue on Signal Processing for Cognitive Radio Networks, November 2008

entry.title: Fitness Landscape Analysis for Dynamic Resource Allocation in Multiuser OFDM Based Cognitive Radio Systems
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: List Decoding of Burst Errors
entry.summary: A generalization of the Reiger bound is presented for the list decoding of burst errors. It is then shown that Reed-Solomon codes attain this bound.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, August 19, 2008

entry.title: Bounds on the Capacity of the Relay Channel with States at the Source
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Asymptotics of Entropy Rate in Special Families of Hidden Markov Chains
entry.summary: We derive an asymptotic formula for entropy rate of a hidden Markov chain around a "weak Black Hole". We also discuss applications of the asymptotic formula to the asymptotic behaviors of certain channels.

entry.title: A Bit of Information Theory, and the Data Augmentation Algorithm Converges
entry.summary: The data augmentation (DA) algorithm is a simple and powerful tool in statistical computing. In this note basic information theory is used to prove a nontrivial convergence theorem for the DA algorithm.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Transactions on Information Theory 54 (2008) 5186--5188

entry.title: The Ergodic Capacity of The MIMO Wire-Tap Channel
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn to provide a more rigorous proof of the converse of Theorem 1 and Lemma 1 as well.

entry.title: A bound on the size of linear codes
entry.summary: We present a bound on the size of linear codes. This bound is independent of other known bounds, e.g. the Griesmer bound.
entry.arxiv:comment: A new version of this article is now available

entry.title: A simple algorithm for decoding both errors and erasures of Reed-Solomon codes
entry.summary: A simple algorithm for decoding both errors and erasures of Reed-Solomon codes is described.
entry.arxiv:comment: Comments: 6 pages. Proceedings of the Workshop "Coding Theory Days in St. Petersburg", Russia, October 2008. pp.18-21

entry.title: DNA-Inspired Information Concealing
entry.summary: Protection of the sensitive content is crucial for extensive information sharing. We present a technique of information concealing, based on introduction and maintenance of families of repeats. Repeats in DNA constitute a basic obstacle for its reconstruction by hybridization.

entry.title: A Generalized Cut-Set Bound
entry.summary: In this paper, we generalize the well known cut-set bound to the problem of lossy transmission of functions of arbitrarily correlated sources over a discrete memoryless multiterminal network.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, 1 figure, a short version of it appears in ISIT 2009

entry.title: Cyclic Codes over Some Finite Rings
entry.summary: In this paper cyclic codes are established with respect to the Mannheim metric over some finite rings by using Gaussian integers and the decoding algorithm for these codes is given.

entry.title: Cyclic Codes over Some Finite Quaternion Integer Rings
entry.summary: In this paper, cyclic codes are established over some finite quaternion integer rings with respect to the quaternion Mannheim distance, and de- coding algorithm for these codes is given.

entry.title: Further Analysis on Resource Allocation in Wireless Communications Under Imperfect Channel State Information
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to some errors.

entry.title: Spectrum of Fractal Interpolation Functions
entry.summary: In this paper we compute the Fourier spectrum of the Fractal Interpolation Functions FIFs as introduced by Michael Barnsley. We show that there is an analytical way to compute them. In this paper we attempt to solve the inverse problem of FIF by using the spectrum

entry.title: On semifast Fourier transform algorithms
entry.summary: We consider the relations between well-known Fourier transform algorithms.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages. Proceedings of the XII international symposium on problems of redundancy in information and control systems at St.Petersburg, Russia, May 2009, pp.65-70

entry.title: The non-existence of a [[13,5,4]] quantum stabilizer code
entry.summary: We solve one of the oldest problems in the theory of quantum stabilizer codes by proving the non-existence of quantum [[13,5,4]]-codes.

entry.title: On an Inequality of Karlin and Rinott Concerning Weighted Sums of i.i.d. Random Variables
entry.summary: We present an entropy comparison result concerning weighted sums of independent and identically distributed random variables.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Adv. in Appl. Probab. 40 (2008) 1223-1226

entry.title: Semidefinite programming, harmonic analysis and coding theory
entry.summary: These lecture notes where presented as a course of the CIMPA summer school in Manila, July 20-30, 2009, Semidefinite programming in algebraic combinatorics. This version is an update June 2010.

entry.title: Capacity Region of a State Dependent Degraded Broadcast Channel with Noncausal Transmitter CSI
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to a mistake in the previous version.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn due to a mistake in the previous version

entry.title: Sparse Eigenvectors of the Discrete Fourier Transform
entry.summary: We construct a basis of sparse eigenvectors for the N-dimensional discrete Fourier transform. The sparsity differs from the optimal by at most a factor of four. When N is a perfect square, the basis is orthogonal.

entry.title: The MacWilliams Theorem for Four-Dimensional Modulo Metrics
entry.summary: In this paper, the MacWilliams theorem is stated for codes over finite field with four-dimensional modulo metrics.
entry.arxiv:comment: A similar paper had been already published by Jay Wood

entry.title: Refined rate of channel polarization
entry.summary: A rate-dependent upper bound of the best achievable block error probability of polar codes with successive-cancellation decoding is derived.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 or 6 pages, submitted to IEEE Int. Symp. Info. Theory 2010

entry.title: A Unified Algebraic Framework for Fuzzy Image Compression and Mathematical Morphology
entry.summary: In this paper we show how certain techniques of image processing, having different scopes, can be joined together under a common "algebraic roof".
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: V. Di Gesu', S.K. Pal, and A. Petrosino Eds.: WILF 2009, LNAI 5571, pp. 205-212, Springer-Verlag 2009

entry.title: The Degrees of Freedom Region of the MIMO Cognitive Interference Channel with No CSIT
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s) for revision.

entry.title: On the scaling of feedback bits to achieve the full multiplexing gain over the Gaussian broadcast channel using DPC
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s) for revision.

entry.title: Bounds for binary codes relative to pseudo-distances of k points
entry.summary: We apply Schrijver's semidefinite programming method to obtain improved upper bounds on generalized distances and list decoding radii of binary codes.

entry.title: New MDS Self-Dual Codes over Large Finite Fields
entry.summary: We construct MDS Euclidean and Hermitian self-dual codes over large finite fields of odd and even characteristics. Our codes arise from cyclic and negacyclic duadic codes.

entry.title: Bounds for codes for a non-symmetric ternary channel
entry.summary: We provide bounds for codes for a non-symmetric channel or, equivalently, for ternary codes with the Manhattan distance.
entry.arxiv:comment: To be presented at 31st WIC Symposium on Information Theory in the Benelux, Rotterdam, the Netherlands, May 11-12, 2010

entry.title: Applications of semidefinite programming to coding theory
entry.summary: We survey recent generalizations and improvements of the linear programming method that involve semidefinite programming. A general framework using group representations and tools from graph theory is provided.

entry.title: Collaborative Decoding of Interleaved Reed-Solomon Codes using Gaussian Elimination
entry.summary: We propose an alternative method for collaborative decoding of interleaved Reed-Solomon codes. Simulation results for a concatenated coding scheme using polar codes as inner codes are included.

entry.title: Hadamard Upper Bound (HUB) on Optimum Joint Decoding Capacity of Wyner Gaussian Cellular MAC
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Multivariate vector sampling expansions in shift invariant subspaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we study multivariate vector sampling expansions on general finitely generated shift-invariant subspaces. Necessary and sufficient conditions for a multivariate vector sampling theorem to hold are given.

entry.title: Design and simulation of a sigma delta ADC
entry.summary: In this report we describe the design and simulation of a Sigma Delta ADC in Matlan/Simulink
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to poor writing

entry.title: Bounds from a Card Trick
entry.summary: We describe a new variation of a mathematical card trick, whose analysis leads to new lower bounds for data compression and estimating the entropy of Markov sources.

entry.title: Condensation into ground state in binary string models
entry.summary: The ensemble of binary strings defined via strong-interaction model exhibits enhanced condensation (collapse) into ground state below certain temperature. The non-interaction model shows gradual accumulation into ground state as temperature approaches zero

entry.title: Errata list for "Error Control Coding" by Lin and Costello
entry.summary: This document lists some errors found in the second edition of Error Control Coding by Shu Lin and Daniel J. Costello, Jr.

entry.title: Some More Functions That Are Not APN Infinitely Often. The Case of Kasami exponents
entry.summary: We prove a necessary condition for some polynomials of Kasami degree to be APN over F_{q^n} for large n.

entry.title: The Algebra of Two Dimensional Patterns
entry.summary: The article presents an algebra to represent two dimensional patterns using reciprocals of polynomials. Such a representation will be useful in neural network training and it provides a method of training patterns that is much more efficient than a pixel-wise representation.

entry.title: Inequalities Among Logarithmic-Mean Measures
entry.summary: In this paper we shall consider some famous means such as arithmetic, harmonic, geometric, logarithmic means, etc. Inequalities involving logarithmic mean with differences among other means are presented

entry.title: Common Signal Analysis
entry.summary: A common signal is defined for any two signals which have non-zero correlation. A mathematical method is provided to extract the best obtainable common signal between the two signals. This analysis is extended to extracting common signal among three signals.

entry.title: Sum Capacity of Gaussian Interfering Multiple Access Channels in the Low Interference Regime
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to an incorrect proof.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn due to an incorrect proof

entry.title: On the average sensitivity of laced Boolean functions
entry.summary: In this paper we obtain the average sensitivity of the laced Boolean functions. This confirms a conjecture of Shparlinski. We also compute the weights of the laced Boolean functions and show that they are almost balanced.

entry.title: On extremal self-dual ternary codes of length 48
entry.summary: All extremal ternary codes of length 48 that have some automorphism of prime order $p\geq 5$ are equivalent to one of the two known codes, the Pless code or the extended quadratic residue code.

entry.title: Perfect Mannheim, Lipschitz and Hurwitz weight codes
entry.summary: In this paper, upper bounds on codes over Gaussian integers, Lipschitz integers and Hurwitz integers with respect to Mannheim metric, Lipschitz and Hurwitz metric are given.

entry.title: Conditional and unconditional information inequalities: an algebraic example
entry.summary: We provide a simple example showing that some conditional information inequalities (even in a weak form) cannot be derived from unconditional inequalities.

entry.title: Optimal Sum-Rate of the Vector Gaussian CEO Problem
entry.summary: This document is withdrawn due to an error in Lemma 4.
entry.arxiv:comment: This document is withdrawn due to an error in Lemma 4

entry.title: Codes Satisfying the Chain Condition with a Poset Weights
entry.summary: In this paper we extend the concept of generalized Wei weights for poset-weight codes and show that all linear codes C satisfy the chain condition if support of C is a subposet totally ordered.

entry.title: A note on Shannon entropy
entry.summary: We present a somewhat different way of looking on Shannon entropy. This leads to an axiomatisation of Shannon entropy that is essentially equivalent to that of Fadeev. In particular we give a new proof of Fadeev theorem.

entry.title: Bounds for projective codes from semidefinite programming
entry.summary: We apply the semidefinite programming method to derive bounds for projective codes over a finite field.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Advances in mathematics of communications 7, 2 (2013) 127-145

entry.title: A New Determinant Inequality of Positive Semi-Definite Matrices
entry.summary: A new determinant inequality of positive semidefinite matrices is discovered and proved by us. This new inequality is useful for attacking and solving a variety of optimization problems arising from the design of wireless communication systems.

entry.title: A variant of list plus CRC concatenated polar code
entry.summary: A new family of codes based on polar codes, soft concatenation and list+CRC decoding is proposed. Numerical experiments show the performance competitive with industry standards and Tal, Vardy approach.

entry.title: Correction to "A Note on Gallager's Capacity Theorem for Waveform Channels"
entry.summary: We correct an alleged contradiction to Gallager's capacity theorem for waveform channels as presented in a poster at the 2012 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory.

entry.title: Submartingale Property of E_0 Under The Polarization Transformations
entry.summary: We prove that the relation $E_0(\rho, W^{-}) + E_0(\rho, W^{+}) \geq 2 E_0(\rho, W)$ holds for any binary input discrete memoryless channel $W$, and $\rho \geq 0$.

entry.title: A Construction for Perfect Periodic Autocorrelation Sequences
entry.summary: We introduce a construction for perfect periodic autocorrelation sequences over roots of unity. The sequences share similarities to the perfect periodic sequence constructions of Liu, Frank, and Milewski.

entry.title: Constacyclic Codes over $F_p+vF_p$
entry.summary: In this paper, we study constacyclic codes over $F_p+vF_p$, where $p$ is an odd prime and $v^2=v$. The polynomial generators of all constacyclic codes over $F_p+vF_p$ are characterized and their dual codes are also determined.

entry.title: Generalized parallel concatenated block codes based on BCH and RS codes, construction and Iterative decoding
entry.summary: In this paper, a generalization of parallel concatenated block GPCB codes based on BCH and RS codes is presented.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal Of Telecommunications, Volume 12, Issue 1, January 2012

entry.title: Scrambling Code Planning in TD-SCDMA Systems
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial sign error in equation 2.

entry.title: Homogeneous Weights of Matrix Product Codes over Finite Principal Ideal Rings
entry.summary: In this paper, the homogeneous weights of matrix product codes over finite principal ideal rings are studied and a lower bound for the minimum homogeneous weights of such matrix product codes is obtained.

entry.title: Construction of Self-dual Codes over $F_p+vF_p$
entry.summary: In this paper, we determine all self-dual codes over $F_p+vF_p$ ($v^2=v$) in terms of self-dual codes over the finite field $F_p$ and give an explicit construction for self-dual codes over $F_p+vF_p$, where $p$ is a prime.

entry.title: Joint Space Decomposition-and-Synthesis Theory for K-User MIMO Channels: Interference Alignment and DoF Region
entry.summary: This paper studies DoF of interference alignment in K-user MIMO interference channels.
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdraw because lack of converse theorem for the result

entry.title: Power Minimization in Multi-pair Two-Way Relaying
entry.summary: This doc provides some proofs in our submitted journal paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors as this article provides some proofs for the results in the paper arXiv:1307.0052

entry.title: Beamforming Design for Multiuser Two-Way Relaying: A Unified Approach via Max-Min SINR
entry.summary: In this paper, we develop a unified framework for beamforming designs in non-regenerative multiuser two-way relaying (TWR).
entry.arxiv:comment: 31 pages, 9 figures, submitted to IEEE Trans. Signal Process

entry.title: Overhead-Optimized Gamma Network Codes
entry.summary: We design a network coding scheme with minimum reception overhead and linear encoding/decoding complexity.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper was accepted as a short paper and presented as a poster in the 2013 IEEE International Symposium on Network Coding (NetCod'13), Calgary, Canada

entry.title: A short note on the axiomatic requirements of uncertainty measure
entry.summary: In this note, we argue that the axiomatic requirement of range to the measure of aggregated total uncertainty (ATU) in Dempster-Shafer theory is not reasonable.

entry.title: An MDS code associated to an elliptic curve
entry.summary: We will construct an MDS(= the most distance separable) code $C$ which admits a decomposition such that every factor is still MDS. An effective way of decoding will be also discussed.

entry.title: Computing the Kullback-Leibler Divergence between two Weibull Distributions
entry.summary: We derive a closed form solution for the Kullback-Leibler divergence between two Weibull distributions. These notes are meant as reference material and intended to provide a guided tour towards a result that is often mentioned but seldom made explicit in the literature.

entry.title: An asymptotic formula in q for the number of [n,k] q-ary MDS codes
entry.summary: We obtain an asymptotic formula in q for the number of MDS codes of length n and dimension k over a finite field with q elements.

entry.title: Universal Polar Decoding with Channel Knowledge at the Encoder
entry.summary: Polar coding over a class of binary discrete memoryless channels with channel knowledge at the encoder is studied. It is shown that polar codes achieve the capacity of convex and one-sided classes of symmetric channels.

entry.title: Polar Codes: Graph Representation and Duality
entry.summary: In this paper, we present an iterative construction of a polar code and develop properties of the dual of a polar code. Based on this approach, belief propagation of a polar code can be presented in the context of low-density parity check codes.

entry.title: A General Construction of Binary Sequences with Optimal Autocorrelation
entry.summary: A general construction of binary sequences with low autocorrelation are considered in the paper. Based on recent progresses about this topic and this construction, several classes of binary sequences with optimal autocorrelation and other low autocorrelation are presented.

entry.title: Inequalities for the Bayes Risk
entry.summary: Several inequalities are presented which, in part, generalize inequalities by Weinstein and Weiss, giving rise to new lower bounds for the Bayes risk under squared error loss.

entry.title: Hamming's Original Paper Rewritten in Symbolic Form: A Preamble to Coding Theory
entry.summary: In this note we try to bring out the ideas of Hamming's classic paper on coding theory in a form understandable by undergraduate students of mathematics.

entry.title: Nested Polar Codes Achieve the Shannon Rate-Distortion Function and the Shannon Capacity
entry.summary: It is shown that nested polar codes achieve the Shannon rate-distortion function for arbitrary (binary or non-binary) discrete memoryless sources and the Shannon capacity of arbitrary discrete memoryless channels.

entry.title: Computing the Kullback-Leibler Divergence between two Generalized Gamma Distributions
entry.summary: We derive a closed form solution for the Kullback-Leibler divergence between two generalized gamma distributions. These notes are meant as a reference and provide a guided tour towards a result of practical interest that is rarely explicated in the literature.

entry.title: An Information Identity for State-dependent Channels with Feedback
entry.summary: In this technical note, we investigate information quantities of state-dependent communication channels with corrupted information fed back from the receiver. We derive an information identity which can be interpreted as a law of conservation of information flows.

entry.title: A Light Discussion and Derivation of Entropy
entry.summary: The expression for entropy sometimes appears mysterious - as it often is asserted without justification. This short manuscript contains a discussion of the underlying assumptions behind entropy as well as simple derivation of this ubiquitous quantity.

entry.title: Understanding Shannon's Entropy metric for Information
entry.summary: Shannon's metric of "Entropy" of information is a foundational concept of information theory. This article is a primer for novices that presents an intuitive way of understanding, remembering, and/or reconstructing Shannon's Entropy metric for information.
entry.arxiv:comment: A primer for novices, presenting an intuitive way of understanding the topic

entry.title: Noiseless coding theorem proved by induction for finite stationary memoryless information sources
entry.summary: Noiseless coding theorem for finite stationary memoryless information sources is proved by using induction on the number of source symbols and the inequality of geometric and harmonic means.

entry.title: OS effect in SLM schemes with correlation
entry.summary: BER is analyzed SLM schemes with correlation metric.

entry.title: BCK-algebras arising from block codes
entry.summary: In this paper, we will provide an algorithm which allows us to find a BCK-algebra starting from a given block code.

entry.title: Frames for subspaces of $\mathbb{C}^N$
entry.summary: We present a theory of finite frames for subspaces of $\mathbb{C}^N$ . The definition of a subspace frame is given and results analogous to those from frame theory for $\mathbb{C}^N$ are proven.

entry.title: Error-Correction Capability of Reed-Muller codes
entry.summary: We present an asymptotic limit between correctable and uncor-rectable errors on the Reed-Muller codes of any order. This limit is theoretical and does not depend of any decoding algorithm.

entry.title: Some Notes on Constructions of Binary Sequences with Optimal Autocorrelation
entry.summary: Constructions of binary sequences with low autocorrelation are considered in the paper. Based on recent progresses about this topic, several more general constructions of binary sequences with optimal autocorrelations and other low autocorrelations are presented.

entry.title: Array Orthogonality in Higher Dimensions
entry.summary: We generalize the array orthogonality property for perfect autocorrelation sequences to $n$-dimensional arrays. The generalized array orthogonality property is used to derive a number of $n$-dimensional perfect array constructions.

entry.title: The Foundation of Big Data: Experiments, Formulation, and Applications
entry.summary: The central theme of this talk is to promote the non-asymptotic statistical viewpoint in the context of massive datasets. The classical viewpoint breaks down when the data size becomes large.

entry.title: A class of cyclic codes whose dual have five zeros
entry.summary: In this paper, a family of cyclic codes over $\mathbb{F}_{p}$ whose duals have five zeros is presented, where $p$ is an odd prime. Furthermore, the weight distributions of these cyclic codes are determined.

entry.title: Binary sequences with three-valued cross correlations of different lengths
entry.summary: In this paper, new pairs of binary sequences with three cross correlation values are presented. The cross correlation values are shown to be low. Finally we present some numerical results and some open problems.

entry.title: A note on linear codes and nonassociative algebras obtained from skew-polynomial rings
entry.summary: Different approaches to construct linear codes using skew polynomials can be unified by using the nonassociative algebras built from skew-polynomial rings by Petit.

entry.title: Coded Caching with Heterogenous Cache Sizes
entry.summary: We investigate the coded caching scheme under heterogenous cache sizes.

entry.title: Quasi-cyclic Codes of Index 1.5
entry.summary: We introduce quasi-cyclic codes of index 1.5, construct such codes in terms of polynomials and matrices; and prove that the quasi-cyclic codes of index 1.5 are asymptotically good.

entry.title: An Introduction to Algebraic Geometry codes
entry.summary: We present an introduction to the theory of algebraic geometry codes. Starting from evaluation codes and codes from order and weight functions, special attention is given to one-point codes and, in particular, to the family of Castle codes.

entry.title: On self-dual MRD codes
entry.summary: We determine the automorphism group of Gabidulin codes of full length and characterise when these codes are equivalent to self-dual codes.
entry.arxiv:comment: Improved exposition according to the referees' comments

entry.title: Reconstruction of sparse wavelet signals from partial Fourier measurements
entry.summary: In this paper, we show that high-dimensional sparse wavelet signals of finite levels can be constructed from their partial Fourier measurements on a deterministic sampling set with cardinality about a multiple of signal sparsity.

entry.title: Kasami type codes of higher relative dimension
entry.summary: Some new Kasami type codes of higher relative dimension is introduced. Their weight distribution is determined.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1506.01498

entry.title: Nonexistence of Generalized Bent Functions From $Z_{2}^{n}$ to $Z_{m}$
Comparison between GFDM and VOFDM
entry.summary: This document provides a comparison of the transmission techniques used in Generalized Frequency Division Multiplexing (GFDM) and Vector-OFDM (VOFDM). Within the document both systems are coarsely described and common and distinct properties are highlighted.

entry.title: Simple relay channel
entry.summary: In 1987, Cover proposed an interesting problem in the simple relay channel as shown in figure 1.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an error

entry.title: Constant dimension codes from Riemann-Roch spaces
entry.summary: Some families of constant dimension codes arising from Riemann-Roch spaces associated to particular divisors of a curve $\X$ are constructed. These families are generalizations of the one constructed by Hansen

entry.title: When the extension property does not hold
entry.summary: A complete extension theorem for linear codes over a module alphabet and the symmetrized weight composition is proved. It is shown that an extension property with respect to arbitrary weight function does not hold for module alphabets with a noncyclic socle.

entry.title: Good Self-dual Generalized Quasi-Cyclic Codes Exist
entry.summary: We show that there are good long binary generalized quasi-cyclic self-dual (either Type I or Type II) codes.

entry.title: Balanced Permutation Codes
entry.summary: Motivated by charge balancing constraints for rank modulation schemes, we introduce the notion of balanced permutations and derive the capacity of balanced permutation codes. We also describe simple interleaving methods for permutation code constructions and show that they approach capacity

entry.title: The Narayana Universal Code
entry.summary: This paper presents a method of universal coding based on the Narayana series. The rules necessary to make such coding possible have been found and the length of the resulting code has been determined to follow the Narayana count.

entry.title: On Reliability Function Of BSC: Expanding The Region, Where It Is Known Exactly
entry.summary: The region of rates ("straight-line"), where the BSC reliability function is known exactly, is expanded.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published in Problems of Information Transmission, vol. 51, no. 4, pp. 3-22, 2015

entry.title: Matrix-Product Complementary dual Codes
entry.summary: Linear complementary dual codes (LCD) are linear codes satisfying $C\cap C^{\perp}=\{0\}$. Under suitable conditions, matrix-product codes that are complementary dual codes are characterized. We construct LCD codes using quasi-orthogonal matrices. Some asymptotic results are derived.

entry.title: On New Quantum Codes From Matrix Product Codes
entry.summary: In this paper, by using matrix product codes, several classes of new quantum codes are obtained. Moreover, some of them have better parameters than the previous quantum codes available.

entry.title: On Deep Holes of Projective Reed-Solomon Codes
entry.summary: In this paper, we obtain new results on the covering radius and deep holes for projective Reed-Solomon (PRS) codes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, accepted by The 2016 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory (ISIT2016)

entry.title: Separating Topological Noise from Features using Persistent Entropy
entry.summary: In this paper, we derive a simple method for separating topological noise from topological features using a novel measure for comparing persistence barcodes called persistent entropy.

entry.title: On the Capacity Region of Multiple Access Channel
entry.summary: The capacity region of a multiple access channel is discussed. It was found that orthogonal multiple access and non orthogonal multiple access have the same capacity region under the constraint of same sum power.

entry.title: On Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access in Downlink
entry.summary: Non orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) in the downlink is discussed in this letter. When combined with soft frequency reuse, NOMA is detrimental to user fairness by increasing the data rate of a near user at the cost of data rate of a far user.

entry.title: On the Optimality of Time Division for Broadcast Channels
entry.summary: We provide a necessary and sufficient condition that under some technical assumption characterizes all two-receiver broadcast channels for which time division is optimal for transmission of private messages.

entry.title: Public Key Protocols over the Ring E_p(m)
entry.summary: In this paper we use the nonrepresentable ring E_p(m)to introduce public key cryptosystems in noncommutative settings and based on the Semigrouop Action Problem and the Decomposition Problem respectively.

entry.title: A note on some inequalities used in channel polarization and polar coding
entry.summary: We give a unified treatment of some inequalities that are used in the proofs of channel polarization theorems involving a binary-input discrete memoryless channel.

entry.title: Equivalence of Quasi-cyclic Codes over Finite Fields
entry.summary: This paper considers the equivalence problem for quasi-cyclic codes over finite fields. The results obtained are used to construct isodual quasi-cyclic codes.

entry.title: Another $q$-Polynomial Approach to Cyclic Codes
entry.summary: Recently, a $q$-polynomial approach to the construction and analysis of cyclic codes over $\gf(q)$ was given by Ding and Ling. The objective of this paper is to give another $q$-polynomial approach to all cyclic codes over $\gf(q)$.

entry.title: The Entropy Region is not Closed Under Duality
entry.summary: We import a duality notion coming from polymatroids to define duality for information inequalities. We show that the entropy region for $n\ge 5$ is not closed under duality. Our result answers an open question of Mat\`u\v{s} (1992).

entry.title: Information Rates and post-FEC BER Prediction in Optical Fiber Communications
entry.summary: Information-theoretic metrics to analyze optical fiber communications systems with binary and nonbinary soft-decision FEC are reviewed. The numerical evaluation of these metrics in both simulations and experiments is also discussed. Ready-to-use closed-form approximations are presented.

entry.title: Non-linear Cyclic Codes that Attain the Gilbert-Varshamov Bound
entry.summary: We prove that there exist non-linear binary cyclic codes that attain the Gilbert-Varshamov bound.

entry.title: An Inequality for the Correlation of Two Functions Operating on Symmetric Bivariate Normal Variables
entry.summary: An inequality is derived for the correlation of two univariate functions operating on symmetric bivariate normal random variables. The inequality is a simple consequence of the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality.

entry.title: Recursive constructions and their maximum likelihood decoding
entry.summary: We consider recursive decoding techniques for RM codes, their subcodes, and newly designed codes. For moderate lengths up to 512, we obtain near-optimum decoding with feasible complexity.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. 38th Allerton Conf. Communication, Control, and Computing, Monticello, IL, USA, 2000, pp. 71-80

entry.title: On decoding algorithms for polar codes
entry.summary: We survey the known list decoding algorithms for polar codes and compare their complexity. Index terms: Polar codes; Reed-Muller codes; successive cancellation decoding.

entry.title: PSPACE hardness of approximating the capacity of Markoff channels with noiseless feedback
entry.summary: It will be proved that computing the capacity of a Markoff channel with noiseless feedback is PSPACE-hard.

entry.title: Codes with Unequal Disjoint Local Erasure Correction Constraints
entry.summary: Recently, locally repairable codes (LRCs) with local erasure correction constraints that are unequal and disjoint have been proposed. In this work, we study the same topic and provide some improved and additional results.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1701.07340

entry.title: A Simple Proof of Fast Polarization
entry.summary: Fast polarization is an important and useful property of polar codes. It was proved for the binary polarizing $2 \times 2$ kernel by Arikan and Telatar. The proof was later generalized by Sasoglu. We give a simplified proof.

entry.title: Constant composition codes derived from linear codes
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose a class of linear codes and obtain their weight distribution. Some of these codes are almost optimal. Moreover, several classes of constant composition codes(CCCs) are constructed as subcodes of linear codes.

entry.title: Correction to "The Generalized Stochastic Likelihood Decoder: Random Coding and Expurgated Bounds"
entry.summary: This purpose of this letter is to handle a gap that was found in the proof of Theorem 2 in the paper "The generalized stochastic likelihood decoder: random coding and expurgated bounds."

entry.title: On the letter frequencies and entropy of written Marathi
entry.summary: We carry out a comprehensive analysis of letter frequencies in contemporary written Marathi. We determine sets of letters which statistically predominate any large generic Marathi text, and use these sets to estimate the entropy of Marathi.

entry.title: Fault-Tolerant Dot-Product Engines
entry.summary: Coding schemes are presented that provide the ability to correct and detect computational errors while using dot-product engines for integer vector--matrix multiplication. Both the $L_1$-metric and the Hamming metric are considered.

entry.title: On the Feasibility of Network Alignment for Three-Source Three-Destination Multiple Unicast Networks with Delays
entry.summary: A transform approach to network coding was introduced by Bavirisetti et al. (arXiv:1103.3882v3 [cs.IT]) as a tool to view wireline networks with delays as $k$-instantaneous networks (for some large $k$). When the local encoding kernels (LEKs) of the network are varied with every time block of length $k > 1$, the network is said to use block time varying LEKs. In this work, we propose a Precoding Based Network Alignment (PBNA) scheme based on transform approach and block time varying LEKs for three-source three-destination multiple unicast network with delays (3-S 3-D MUN-D). In a recent work, Meng et al. (arXiv:1202.3405v1 [cs.IT]) reduced the infinite set of sufficient conditions for feasibility of PBNA in a three-source three-destination instantaneous multiple unicast network as given by Das et al. (arXiv:1008.0235v1 [cs.IT]) to a finite set and also showed that the conditions are necessary. We show that the conditions of Meng et al. are also necessary and sufficient conditions for feasibility of PBNA based on transform approach and block time varying LEKs for 3-S 3-D MUN-D.

entry.title: A Note on the Injection Distance
entry.summary: Koetter and Kschischang showed in [R. Koetter and F.R. Kschischang, "Coding for Errors and Erasures in Random Network Coding," IEEE Trans. Inform. Theory, {54(8), 2008] that the network coding counterpart of Gabidulin codes performs asymptotically optimal with respect to the subspace distance. Recently, Silva and Kschischang introduced in [D. Silva and F.R. Kschischang, "On Metrics for Error Correction in Network Coding," To appear in IEEE Trans. Inform. Theory, ArXiv: 0805.3824v4[cs.IT], 2009] the injection distance to give a detailed picture of what happens in noncoherent network coding. We show that the above codes are also asymptotically optimal with respect to this distance.

entry.title: Noisy Index Coding with Quadrature Amplitude Modulation (QAM)
entry.summary: This paper discusses noisy index coding problem over Gaussian broadcast channel. We propose a technique for mapping the index coded bits to M-QAM symbols such that the receivers whose side information satisfies certain conditions get coding gain, which we call the QAM side information coding gain. We compare this with the PSK side information coding gain, which was discussed in "Index Coded PSK Modulation," arXiv:1356200, [cs.IT] 19 September 2015.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages; 5 figures. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1509.05874

entry.title: On Bounded-Weight Error-Correcting Codes
entry.summary: This paper computationally obtains optimal bounded-weight, binary, error-correcting codes for a variety of distance bounds and dimensions. We compare the sizes of our codes to the sizes of optimal constant-weight, binary, error-correcting codes, and evaluate the differences.

entry.title: Improved error bounds for the erasure/list scheme: the binary and spherical cases
entry.summary: We derive improved bounds on the error and erasure rate for spherical codes and for binary linear codes under Forney's erasure/list decoding scheme and prove some related results.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, 3 figures. Submitted to IEEE Transactions on Informatin Theory in May 2001, will appear in Oct. 2004 (tentative)
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Transactions on Informatin Theory, vol. 50, no. 10, 2004, pp. 2503-2511

entry.title: The asymptotic number of binary codes and binary matroids
entry.summary: The asyptotic number of nonequivalent binary n-codes is determined. This is also the asymptotic number of nonisomorphic binary n-matroids. The connection to a result of Lefmann, Roedl, Phelps is explored. The latter states that almost all binary n-codes have a trivial automorphism group.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: SIAM Journal of Discrete Mathematics 19 (2005) 691-699

entry.title: Shannon meets Wiener II: On MMSE estimation in successive decoding schemes
entry.summary: We continue to discuss why MMSE estimation arises in coding schemes that approach the capacity of linear Gaussian channels. Here we consider schemes that involve successive decoding, such as decision-feedback equalization or successive cancellation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 5 figures. To appear in Proc. 2004 Allerton Conf. (Monticello, IL), Sept. 2004; final version

entry.title: On the role of MMSE estimation in approaching the information-theoretic limits of linear Gaussian channels: Shannon meets Wiener
entry.summary: We discuss why MMSE estimation arises in lattice-based schemes for approaching the capacity of linear Gaussian channels, and comment on its properties.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. 2003 Allerton Conf. (Monticello, IL), pp. 430-439, Oct. 2003

entry.title: A simple algorithm for decoding Reed-Solomon codes and its relation to the Welch-Berlekamp algorithm
entry.summary: A simple and natural Gao algorithm for decoding algebraic codes is described. Its relation to the Welch-Berlekamp and Euclidean algorithms is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages. Submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, vol. IT-51, no. 3, pp. 1196-1198, 2005.

entry.title: Concavity of the auxiliary function appearing in quantum reliability function an classical-quantum channels
entry.summary: Concavity of the auxiliary function which appears in the random coding exponent as the lower bound of the quantum reliability function for general quantum states is proven for s between 0 and 1.

entry.title: Idempotents, Mattson-Solomon Polynomials and Binary LDPC codes
entry.summary: We show how to construct an algorithm to search for binary idempotents which may be used to construct binary LDPC codes. The algorithm, which allows control of the key properties of sparseness, code rate and minimum distance, is constructed in the Mattson-Solomon domain. Some of the new codes, found by using this technique, are displayed.

entry.title: Multilevel expander codes
entry.summary: We define multilevel codes on bipartite graphs that have properties analogous to multilevel serial concatenations. A decoding algorithm is described that corrects a proportion of errors equal to half the Blokh-Zyablov bound on the minimum distance. The error probability of this algorithm has exponent similar to that of serially concatenated multilevel codes.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: "Algebraic Coding Theory and Information Theory," Providence, RI: AMS (2005), pp. 69-83.

entry.title: On a Kronecker products sum distance bounds
entry.summary: A binary linear error correcting codes represented by two code families Kronecker products sum are considered. The dimension and distance of new code is investigated. Upper and lower bounds of distance are obtained. Some examples are given. It is shown that some classic constructions are the private cases of considered one. The subclass of codes with equal lower and upper distance bounds is allocated.

entry.title: Dynamic Shannon Coding
entry.summary: We present a new algorithm for dynamic prefix-free coding, based on Shannon coding. We give a simple analysis and prove a better upper bound on the length of the encoding produced than the corresponding bound for dynamic Huffman coding. We show how our algorithm can be modified for efficient length-restricted coding, alphabetic coding and coding with unequal letter costs.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages; conference version presented at ESA 2004; journal version submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory

entry.title: The Viterbi Algorithm: A Personal History
entry.summary: The story of the Viterbi algorithm (VA) is told from a personal perspective. Applications both within and beyond communications are discussed. In brief summary, the VA has proved to be an extremely important algorithm in a surprising variety of fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages; presented at Viterbi Conference, University of Southern California, Los Angeles, March 8, 2005

entry.title: Critical Point for Maximum Likelihood Decoding of Linear Block Codes
entry.summary: In this letter, the SNR value at which the error performance curve of a soft decision maximum likelihood decoder reaches the slope corresponding to the code minimum distance is determined for a random code. Based on this value, referred to as the critical point, new insight about soft bounded distance decoding of random-like codes (and particularly Reed-Solomon codes) is provided.

entry.title: Approximate MAP Decoding on Tail-Biting Trellises
entry.summary: We propose two approximate algorithms for MAP decoding on tail-biting trellises. The algorithms work on a subset of nodes of the tail-biting trellis, judiciously selected. We report the results of simulations on an AWGN channel using the approximate algorithms on tail-biting trellises for the $(24,12)$ Extended Golay Code and a rate 1/2 convolutional code with memory 6.

entry.title: A Fixed-Length Coding Algorithm for DNA Sequence Compression
entry.summary: While achieving a compression ratio of 2.0 bits/base, the new algorithm codes non-N bases in fixed length. It dramatically reduces the time of coding and decoding than previous DNA compression algorithms and some universal compression programs.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages,2 tables,using Bioinformatics Latex template,no more relationship between us and that magazine

entry.title: A Decision Feedback Based Scheme for Slepian-Wolf Coding of sources with Hidden Markov Correlation
entry.summary: We consider the problem of compression of two memoryless binary sources, the correlation between which is defined by a Hidden Markov Model (HMM). We propose a Decision Feedback (DF) based scheme which when used with low density parity check codes results in compression close to the Slepian Wolf limits.

entry.title: Decision Feedback Based Scheme for Slepian-Wolf Coding of sources with Hidden Markov Correlation
entry.summary: We consider the problem of compression of two memoryless binary sources, the correlation between which is defined by a Hidden Markov Model (HMM). We propose a Decision Feedback (DF) based scheme which when used with low density parity check codes results in compression close to the Slepian Wolf limits.

entry.title: Large Alphabets and Incompressibility
entry.summary: We briefly survey some concepts related to empirical entropy -- normal numbers, de Bruijn sequences and Markov processes -- and investigate how well it approximates Kolmogorov complexity. Our results suggest $\ell$th-order empirical entropy stops being a reasonable complexity metric for almost all strings of length $m$ over alphabets of size $n$ about when $n^\ell$ surpasses $m$.

entry.title: A CDMA multiuser detection algorithm based on survey propagation
entry.summary: A computationally tractable CDMA multiuser detection algorithm is developed based on survey propagation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Abstract for my presentation at Randomness and Computation Joint Workshop ``New Horizons in Computing'' and ``Statistical Mechanical Approach to Probabilistic Information Processing'' (18-21 July, 2005, Sendai, Japan)

entry.title: Introduction to Quantum Message Space
entry.summary: This paper develops the quantum analog of the message ensemble of classical information theory as developed by Shannon and Khinchin. The principal mathematical tool is harmonic analysis on the free group with two generators.

entry.title: Chosen-ciphertext attack on noncommutative Polly Cracker
entry.summary: We propose a chosen-ciphertext attack on recently presented noncommutative variant of the well-known Polly Cracker cryptosystem. We show that if one chooses parameters for this noncommutative Polly Cracker as initially proposed, than the system should be claimed as insecure.

entry.title: Signature coding for OR channel with asynchronous access
entry.summary: Signature coding for multiple access OR channel is considered. We prove that in block asynchronous case the upper bound on the minimum code length asymptotically is the same as in the case of synchronous access.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of the 2005 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory, Adelaide, Australia, September 4-9, 2005

entry.title: Expectation maximization as message passing
entry.summary: Based on prior work by Eckford, it is shown how expectation maximization (EM) may be viewed, and used, as a message passing algorithm in factor graphs.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of the 2005 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory, Adelaide, Australia, September 4-9, 2005

entry.title: Families of unitary matrices achieving full diversity
entry.summary: This paper presents an algebraic construction of families of unitary matrices that achieve full diversity. They are obtained as subsets of cyclic division algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of the 2005 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory, Adelaide, Australia, September 4-9, 2005

entry.title: On Multiple User Channels with Causal State Information at the Transmitters
entry.summary: We extend Shannon's result on the capacity of channels with state information to multiple user channels. More specifically, we characterize the capacity (region) of degraded broadcast channels and physically degraded relay channels where the channel state information is causally available at the transmitters. We also obtain inner and outer bounds on the capacity region for multiple access channels with causal state information at the transmitters.

entry.title: Distance-Increasing Maps of All Length by Simple Mapping Algorithms
entry.summary: Distance-increasing maps from binary vectors to permutations, namely DIMs, are useful for the construction of permutation arrays. While a simple mapping algorithm defining DIMs of even length is known, existing DIMs of odd length are either recursively constructed by merging shorter DIMs or defined by much complicated mapping algorithms. In this paper, DIMs of all length defined by simple mapping algorithms are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory

entry.title: The "...system of constraints"
entry.summary: This paper proposes that the mathematical relationship between an entropy distribution and its limit offers some new insight into system performance. This relationship is used to quantify variation among the entities of a system, where variation is defined as tolerance, option, specification or implementation variation among the entities of a system. Variation has a significnt and increasing impact on communications system performance. This paper introduces means to identify, quantify and reduce such performance variations.

entry.title: A Counterexample to Cover's 2P Conjecture on Gaussian Feedback Capacity
entry.summary: We provide a counterexample to Cover's conjecture that the feedback capacity $C_\textrm{FB}$ of an additive Gaussian noise channel under power constraint $P$ be no greater than the nonfeedback capacity $C$ of the same channel under power constraint $2P$, i.e., $C_\textrm{FB}(P) \le C(2P)$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory

entry.title: The Private Key Capacity Region for Three Terminals
entry.summary: We consider a model with three terminals and examine the problem of characterizing the largest rates at which two pairs of terminals can simultaneously generate private keys, each of which is effectively concealed from the remaining terminal.
entry.arxiv:comment: Appeared in the proceedings of the 2004 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory, Chicago, Illinois, June 27 -- July 2, 2004

entry.title: A bound on Grassmannian codes
entry.summary: We give a new asymptotic upper bound on the size of a code in the Grassmannian space. The bound is better than the upper bounds known previously in the entire range of distances except very large values.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Problems of Information Transmission, 2006, vol. 42, no. 2, pp. 77---89

entry.title: Bounds on the Threshold of Linear Programming Decoding
entry.summary: Whereas many results are known about thresholds for ensembles of low-density parity-check codes under message-passing iterative decoding, this is not the case for linear programming decoding. Towards closing this knowledge gap, this paper presents some bounds on the thresholds of low-density parity-check code ensembles under linear programming decoding.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. IEEE Information Theory Workshop (ITW 2006), Punta del Este, Uruguay, March 13-17, 2006

entry.title: Information and Errors in Quantum Teleportation
entry.summary: This article considers the question of the teleportation protocol from an engineering perspective. The protocol ideally requires an authority that ensures that the two communicating parties have a perfectly entangled pair of particles available to them. But this cannot be unconditionally established to the satisfaction of the parties due to the fact that an unknown quantum state cannot be copied. This supports the view that quantum information cannot be treated on the same basis as classical information.

entry.title: Encoding of Functions of Correlated Sources
entry.summary: This submission is being withdrawn due to serious errors in the achievability proofs. The reviewers of the journal I had submitted to had found errors back in 2006. I had forgotten about this paper until I saw the CFP for a JSAC issue on in-network computation. http://www.jsac.ucsd.edu/Calls/in-networkcomputationcfp.pdf.

entry.title: Multiterminal Source Coding with Two Encoders--I: A Computable Outer Bound
entry.summary: In this first part, a computable outer bound is proved for the multiterminal source coding problem, for a setup with two encoders, discrete memoryless sources, and bounded distortion measures.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to the IEEE Transactions on Information Theory; Revised, November 2006. Substantial revision after the first round of reviews

entry.title: Information in Quantum Description and Gate Implementation
entry.summary: This note considers Kak's observer-reference model of quantum information, where it is shown that qubits carry information that is sqrt n / ln n times classical information, where n is the number of components in the measurement system, to analyze information processing in quantum gates. The obverse side of this exponential nature of quantum information is that the computational complexity of implementing unconditionally reliable quantum gates is also exponential.

entry.title: Robust Distributed Source Coding
entry.summary: We consider a distributed source coding system in which several observations are communicated to the decoder using limited transmission rate. The observations must be separately coded. We introduce a robust distributed coding scheme which flexibly trades off between system robustness and compression efficiency. The optimality of this coding scheme is proved for various special cases.
entry.arxiv:comment: 40 pages, submitted to the IEEE Transactions on Information Theory

entry.title: The Discrete Memoryless Multiple Access Channel with Confidential Messages
entry.summary: A multiple-access channel is considered in which messages from one encoder are confidential. Confidential messages are to be transmitted with perfect secrecy, as measured by equivocation at the other encoder. The upper bounds and the achievable rates for this communication situation are determined.

entry.title: An Information-Spectrum Approach to Multiterminal Rate-Distortion Theory
entry.summary: An information-spectrum approach is applied to solve the multiterminal source coding problem for correlated general sources, where sources may be nonstationary and/or nonergodic, and the distortion measure is arbitrary and may be nonadditive. A general formula for the rate-distortion region of the multiterminal source coding problem with the maximum distortion criterion under fixed-length coding is shown in this correspondence.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory (Apr. 2006)

entry.title: Finding roots of polynomials over finite fields
entry.summary: We propose an improved algorithm for finding roots of polynomials over finite fields. This makes possible significant speedup of the decoding process of Bose-Chaudhuri-Hocquenghem, Reed-Solomon, and some other error-correcting codes.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Transactions on Communications, Volume 50, Issue 11, Nov. 2002, Pages:1709 - 1711

entry.title: Linear Predictive Coding as an Estimator of Volatility
entry.summary: In this paper, we present a method of estimating the volatility of a signal that displays stochastic noise (such as a risky asset traded on an open market) utilizing Linear Predictive Coding. The main purpose is to associate volatility with a series of statistical properties that can lead us, through further investigation, toward a better understanding of structural volatility as well as to improve the quality of our current estimates.

entry.title: The single-serving channel capacity
entry.summary: In this paper we provide the answer to the following question: Given a noisy channel and epsilon>0, how many bits can be transmitted with an error of at most epsilon by a single use of the channel?
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the 2006 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory (ISIT)

entry.title: Redundancies of Correction-Capability-Optimized Reed-Muller Codes
entry.summary: This article is focused on some variations of Reed-Muller codes that yield improvements to the rate for a prescribed decoding performance under the Berlekamp-Massey-Sakata algorithm with majority voting. Explicit formulas for the redundancies of the new codes are given.

entry.title: Capacity of the Trapdoor Channel with Feedback
entry.summary: We establish that the feedback capacity of the trapdoor channel is the logarithm of the golden ratio and provide a simple communication scheme that achieves capacity. As part of the analysis, we formulate a class of dynamic programs that characterize capacities of unifilar finite-state channels. The trapdoor channel is an instance that admits a simple analytic solution.

entry.title: An Enhanced Covering Lemma for Multiterminal Source Coding
entry.summary: An enhanced covering lemma for a Markov chain is proved in this paper, and then the distributed source coding problem of correlated general sources with one average distortion criterion under fixed-length coding is investigated. Based on the enhanced lemma, a sufficient and necessary condition for determining the achievability of rate-distortion triples is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Proc. 2006 IEEE Information Theory Workshop, October 22-26, 2006, Chengdu, China. (5 pages)

entry.title: Theoretical analysis of network cranback protocols performance
entry.summary: Suggested the decision of the network cranback protocols performance analyzing problem from Eyal Felstine, Reuven Cohen and Ofer Hadar, " Crankback Prediction in Hierarchical ATM networks", Journal of Network and Systems Management, Vol. 10, No. 3, September 2002. It show that the false alarm probability and probability of successful way crossing can be calculated. The main optimization equations are developed for cranback protocol parameters by using analytical expressions for statistical protocol characteristics.

entry.title: Estimation of the traffic in the binary channel for data networks
entry.summary: It is impossible to provide an effective utilization of communication networks without the analysis of the quantitative characteristics of the traffic in real time. The constant supervision of all channels of the data practically is impracticable because requires transfer of the significant additional information on a network and large resources expenses for devices of the control. Thus, the task on traffic estimation with small expenses in real time is the urgent.

entry.title: List Decoding of Hermitian Codes using Groebner Bases
entry.summary: List decoding of Hermitian codes is reformulated to allow an efficient and simple algorithm for the interpolation step. The algorithm is developed using the theory of Groebner bases of modules. The computational complexity of the algorithm seems comparable to previously known algorithms achieving the same task, and the algorithm is better suited for hardware implementation.

entry.title: Stabilization using both noisy and noiseless feedback
entry.summary: When designing a distributed control system, the system designer has a choice in how to connect the different units through communication channels. In practice, noiseless and noisy channels may coexist. Using the standard toy example of scalar stabilization, this paper shows how a small amount of noiseless feedback can perform a ``supervisory'' role and thereby boost the effectiveness of noisy feedback.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 5 figures, originally presented at MTNS 06

entry.title: Code Spectrum and Reliability Function: Binary Symmetric Channel
entry.summary: A new approach for upper bounding the channel reliability function using the code spectrum is described. It allows to treat in a unified way both a low and a high rate cases. In particular, the earlier known upper bounds are improved, and a new derivation of the sphere-packing bound is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, to be published in Problems of Information Transmission
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Problems of Information Transmission, vol. 42, no. 4, pp. 3-22, 2006

entry.title: Retrieving Reed-Solomon coded data under interpolation-based list decoding
entry.summary: A transform that enables generator-matrix-based Reed-Solomon (RS) coded data to be recovered under interpolation-based list decoding is presented. The transform matrix needs to be computed only once and the transformation of an element from the output list to the desired RS coded data block incurs $k^{2}$ field multiplications, given a code of dimension $k$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages. Submitted to IEEE information theory for possible publication

entry.title: New Constructions of a Family of 2-Generator Quasi-Cyclic Two-Weight Codes and Related Codes
entry.summary: Based on cyclic simplex codes, a new construction of a family of 2-generator quasi-cyclic two-weight codes is given. New optimal binary quasi-cyclic [195, 8, 96], [210, 8, 104] and [240, 8, 120] codes, good QC ternary [195, 6, 126], [208, 6, 135], [221, 6, 144] codes are thus obtained. Furthermre, binary quasi-cyclic self-complementary codes are also constructed.

entry.title: New Models for the Correlation in Sensor Data
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose two new models of spatial correlations in sensor data in a data-gathering sensor network. A particular property of these models is that if a sensor node knows in \textit{how many} bits it needs to transmit its data, then it also knows \textit{which} bits of its data it needs to transmit.

entry.title: Entropy vectors and network codes
entry.summary: We consider a network multicast example that relates the solvability of the multicast problem with the existence of an entropy function. As a result, we provide an alternative approach to the proving of the insufficiency of linear (and abelian) network codes and demonstrate the utility of non-Shannon inequalities to tighten outer bounds on network coding capacity regions.

entry.title: Group characterizable entropy functions
entry.summary: This paper studies properties of entropy functions that are induced by groups and subgroups. We showed that many information theoretic properties of those group induced entropy functions also have corresponding group theoretic interpretations. Then we propose an extension method to find outer bound for these group induced entropy functions.

entry.title: Interpolation-based Decoding of Alternant Codes
entry.summary: We formulate the classical decoding algorithm of alternant codes afresh based on interpolation as in Sudan's list decoding of Reed-Solomon codes, and thus get rid of the key equation and the linear recurring sequences in the theory. The result is a streamlined exposition of the decoding algorithm using a bit of the theory of Groebner bases of modules.
entry.arxiv:comment: submitted to the journal of Advances in Mathematics of Communications

entry.title: Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing: An Overview
entry.summary: Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (OFDM) is a multi-carrier modulation scheme that provides efficient bandwidth utilization and robustness against time dispersive channels. This paper deals with the basic system model for OFDM based systems and with self-interference, or the corruption of desired signal by itself in OFDM systems. A simple transceiver based on OFDM modulation is presented. Important impairments in OFDM systems are mathematically analyzed

entry.title: Isochronous Data Transmission With Rates Close to Channel Capacity
entry.summary: The existing ARQ schemes (including a hybrid ARQ) have a throughput depending on packet error probability. In this paper we describe a strategy for delay tolerant applications which provide a constant throughput until the algorithm robustness criterion is not failed. The algorithm robustness criterion is applied to find the optimum size of the retransmission block in the assumption of the small changes of coding rate within the rate compatible codes family.

entry.title: Computing Extensions of Linear Codes
entry.summary: This paper deals with the problem of increasing the minimum distance of a linear code by adding one or more columns to the generator matrix. Several methods to compute extensions of linear codes are presented. Many codes improving the previously known lower bounds on the minimum distance have been found.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings 2007 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory (ISIT 2007), Nice, France, June 2007, pp. 476-480

entry.title: Constructions of q-Ary Constant-Weight Codes
entry.summary: This paper introduces a new combinatorial construction for q-ary constant-weight codes which yields several families of optimal codes and asymptotically optimal codes. The construction reveals intimate connection between q-ary constant-weight codes and sets of pairwise disjoint combinatorial designs of various types.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, Vol. 53, No. 1, January 2007, pp. 135-146

entry.title: Code spectrum and reliability function: Gaussian channel
entry.summary: A new approach for upper bounding the channel reliability function using the code spectrum is described. It allows to treat both low and high rate cases in a unified way. In particular, the earlier known upper bounds are improved, and a new derivation of the sphere-packing bound is presented.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Problems of Information Transmission, vol. 43, no. 2, pp. 3-24, 2007

entry.title: Reducing the Error Floor
entry.summary: We discuss how the loop calculus approach of [Chertkov, Chernyak '06], enhanced by the pseudo-codeword search algorithm of [Chertkov, Stepanov '06] and the facet-guessing idea from [Dimakis, Wainwright '06], improves decoding of graph based codes in the error-floor domain. The utility of the new, Linear Programming based, decoding is demonstrated via analysis and simulations of the model $[155,64,20]$ code.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 1 figure, invited talk at ITW'07 Tahoe
